title: Exhibition Power and Powerlessness, cloister of St. Blaise
img_alt: Sculpture Two Humans by Seiji Kimoto, St. Blaise Dominican Church, City of Regensburg
intro_text: As part of the application of Regensburg as European Cultural Capital 2010, Seiji Kimoto showed his exhibition "Power and Powerlessness, People - Traces - Shadows" in the cloister of the Dominican Church St. Blaise. The exhibition was opened by the Upper Palatinate Government President Dr. Wilhelm Weidinger on July 29th, with a special greeting by Diocesan Bishop Dr. Gerhard Ludwig Müller, patron of the exhibition. The laudatory speech for Seiji Kimoto was given by the head of the Catholic Academy in Trier diocese, pastor Jürgen Doetsch. The exhibition ended with a panel discussion between government President Weidinger, Lisa Unger-Fischer from Europaeum, former Vice-President of the European Parliament Gerhard Schmid and Pavel Liška from Art Forum East German Gallery on October 17th, 2004. A small booklet with texts by Friedrich Fuchs of the Episcopal art collections in the diocese of Regensburg was issued by the city of Regensburg to accompany the exhibition.
